title: Tell me about a difficult problem you solved.

korean: 작년에 회사에서 큰 프로젝트를 맡았을 때가 기억나요.
처음 맡아보는 규모의 일이라 정말 막막했거든요.
팀원들도 처음 일하는 사람들이 많아서 협업도 쉽지 않았고요.
초반에는 계획도 제대로 안 세워져서 일이 꼬이기 시작했어요.
마감이 다가오는데 진도는 안 나가고, 스트레스가 엄청났죠.
그래서 일단 멈추고 다시 전체적으로 계획을 짰어요.
업무를 세분화해서 각자 역할을 명확하게 나눴고요.
매일 아침 짧은 회의를 해서 진행 상황을 공유했어요.
막히는 부분은 바로바로 다 같이 논의해서 해결했고요.
힘들었지만 팀워크와 체계적인 접근으로 해결한 경험이었어요.
english: I remember when I was assigned a big project at work last year.
It was my first time handling work of that scale, so I was really at a loss.
Many team members were also working for the first time, so collaboration wasn't easy.
In the beginning, plans weren't properly made, so things started going wrong.
The deadline was approaching but progress wasn't being made, and stress was tremendous.
So I stopped and planned the whole thing again.
I subdivided the work and clearly divided each person's role.
We had short meetings every morning to share progress.
We immediately discussed and solved stuck parts together.
I also sought advice from seniors on other teams.
Eventually we completed the project 2 days before the deadline.
It was hard, but it was an experience of solving it with teamwork and a systematic approach.
